text: Glochidion temehaniense, also known by the synonym Phyllanthus temehaniensis, is a species of tree in the family Phyllanthaceae. It is endemic to the Society Islands of French Polynesia, where it is native to the islands of Tahaa, Raiatea, and Huahine.Florence, J. (1997) Flore de la Polynésie française, vol. 1. Paris: Éditions de l'ORSTOM. Like all other species of Glochidion, it is pollinated by leafflower moths in the genus Epicephala.Hembry, D. H.; Okamoto, T.; Gillespie, R. G. (2012) Repeated colonization of remote islands by specialized mutualists. Biology Letters. 8: 258–261. ==References== Category:Flora of French Polynesia temehaniense Category:Least concern plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Glochidion temehaniense
